# Mohammad Saber Rohparwar

Mohammad Saber Rohparwar () is an Afghan former footballer who played as a striker. He was the captain of the Afghanistan national team until 1980. He has been Afghanistan's most successful football player, scoring 25 goals as a footballer in his national team.
Club career
Rohparwar represented Hindukush Kabul F.C. at domestic level, scoring almost 200 goals for his club.
International career
Rohparwar represented Afghanistan for 10 years, scoring 25 goals during his stint with the national team. He was the captain of the national team until 1980 when the Soviet Union invaded the country. He also scored the lone goal against rivals Pakistan during the Afghanistan Republic Day Festival Cup in 1976, scoring the winning goal on a corner kick minutes before game's end.
Coaching career
He was the coach of the Kaur club. During his time as a coach he trained players such as Najib Kohyar.
Personal life
Rohparwar graduated with a degree in Agricultural economics from the Kabul University.
In 1980, during the Soviet invasion and two years after the communist war, he fled to Hamburg in Germany and founded a taxi business. He then created a local Afghan football club called Ariana SV which he is currently a chairman.
His son Rohollah Rohparwar is also a footballer.
